description: A particularly short-lived square temple on the rocky peninsula south  of Weston-super-Mare. Lewis (1966) suggests it may have been converted for use in smelting.
bibliography: Apsimon. “The Roman Temple on Brean Down, Somerset.” Proc University of Bristol Spelaeology Society 10(3) (1965).
ApSimon. Proceedings of the Spelaeological Society 8 (1958): 106 ff.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Brean Down (Somerset).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
